info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 4:01PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Lake and east central Sanders Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 401 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles northeast of Plains, or 22 miles west of Polson, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half-inch size hail. Heavy rain also expected with the potential for localized minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hot Springs, Camas and Lonepine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
